intro: Oxydectes andina, commonly known as the Andean oxydectes, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from red to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in a fine, velvety texture. Oxydectes andina is valued not only for its ornamental appeal but also for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
